snippet: Iraq continues to shape President Obama’s tenure, as he concludes that American interests there prevent him from fully leaving the country to the Iraqis themselves.
abstract: News analysis; possible return to Iraq for American forces underscores just how much country has shaped Pres Obama's presidency; swift march toward Baghdad by Islamic State in Iraq and Syria fighters has forced Obama, whose latest foreign policy doctrine forswore use of nearly all military power, to reconsider his approach to the country.
lead_paragraph: Iraq continues to shape President Obama’s tenure, as he concludes that American interests there prevent him from fully leaving the country to the Iraqis themselves.

headline.main: Obama Finds He Can’t Put Iraq War Behind Him

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
